metadata.title: CVE-2019-11747 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
The "Forget about this site" feature in the History pane is intended toremove all saved user data that indicates a user has visited a site. Thisincludes removing any HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) settingsreceived from sites that use it. Due to a bug, sites on the pre-load listalso have their HSTS setting removed. On the next visit to that site if theuser specifies an http: URL rather than secure https: they will not beprotected by the pre-loaded HSTS setting. After that visit the site's HSTSsetting will be restored. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 69 andFirefox ESR < 68.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11747` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
firefox-geckodriver - 69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
firefox-mozsymbols - 69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '69.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.4').
